intro: Pedicularis gyirongensis, commonly known as the Gyirong lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas, specifically in regions of China and Nepal. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
